lu.uni.distributedsystems.project.bookie

Class BookieServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • lu.uni.distributedsystems.project.common.RemoteControllableServer
      • lu.uni.distributedsystems.project.bookie.BookieServer

  • public class BookieServer
extends RemoteControllableServer
    JSON-RPC server associated with a bookie. Receives JSON-RPC methods via a socket connection. All methods that should be exposed to remote JSON-RPC calls must be defined in this class. Use the @RMI annotation for all such JSON-RPC methods.
    Author:
    steffen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      BookieServer(Bookie bookie, int bookiePort, CommandProcessor commandProcessor)
      Create a new JSON-RPC server instance that is associated with a bookie.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BookieServer

        public BookieServer(Bookie bookie,
                    int bookiePort,
                    CommandProcessor commandProcessor)
        Create a new JSON-RPC server instance that is associated with a bookie.
        Parameters:
        bookie - enclosing bookie this JSON-RPC server is associated with
        bookiePort - port number the JSON-RPC server shall listen on
        commandProcessor - command processor used for processing remote commands

    • Method Detail

      • sayHelloToBookie

        public java.lang.String sayHelloToBookie(java.lang.String gamblerID)
        Simple hello method for testing and reference purposes.

        Please note that the @RMI annotation exposes a method for remote invocation

        Parameters:
        gamblerID - gambler-id of the remote gambler that says hello
        Returns:
        Hello reply message sent back to the remote gambler

      • connect

        public java.lang.String connect(java.lang.String gamblerID,
                                java.lang.String gamblerIP,
                                int gamblerPort)
        Boilerplate code for a gambler who wants to connect to a bookie. specifying at which IP and port to reach the gambler
        Parameters:
        gamblerID - gambler-id of the remote gambler who likes to establish a connection
        gamblerIP - IP address of the remote gambler's JSON-RPC server
        gamblerPort - port on which the remote gambler's JSON-RPC server listens on
        Returns:
        The bookie-id of this bookie.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the JSON-RPC server. All methods tagged with the @RMI annotation will be invokable remotely. All requests as well as all responses will be passed on to the Interceptor instantiated in the body of this method.
